item.description:
This is the sixth session of our HAC group, in which we enjoy James L Kugel's readable guide to the convoluted logic of two main approaches to understanding the contents of the Hebrew bible.

We'll be doing things a little differently for this session. We'll start with a pot-luck dinner at 4:30 PM, and start the discussion at 5:30 PM.

Please read the following sections from our series reference How to Read the Bible: A Guide to Scripture, Then and Now, by James L. Kugel.

  • Chapter 19. P and D 297-316
  • Chapter 20. On the Way to Canaan 317-334
  • Chapter 21. Moses’ Last Words 335-363

Review the following:

  • The article “The Editorial Team Behind the Bible—Interview with Richard Elliott Friedman”
  • The Wikipedia entry on the “Documentary Hypothesis”

Read the following:

  • The Wikipedia entry on the “Passover”
  • The Wikipedia entry on “Moses”
  • The Catholic Encyclopedia entry on “Moses”
  • The Wikipedia entry on the “Islamic View of Moses”


Please catch up with the readings from the earlier sessions. You'll get more out of the group if you're aware of Kugel's approach to the source material.

For more information, see http://www.cthumanist...
item.how_to_find_us: We'll probably be in the social hall or the library.
